node.title: Their Romance Blossomed from a Love of Plants
node.description: Dr. Sarah Santucci and Kevin Zhang met in 2013 at Princeton. She had impressed him with her knowledge of plants.
node.content: ["Dr. Sarah Santucci and Kevin Zhang have always shared a love of plants.", "The pair met when Dr. Santucci stopped by the table for Mr. Zhang\u2019s botany club at Princeton in 2013, when she was a freshman there, and he a sophomore. She impressed him with her ability to identify species on sight.", "\u201cI was heading the table at the activities fair for the botany club and I had this terrarium of carnivorous plants,\u201d Mr. Zhang said. \u201cMost people will walk by and grab some candy and won\u2019t even talk to us or have any questions. But then this girl, Sarah, walks by and was like, \u2018Oh my goodness, is this a Nepenthes?\u2019 So I was very nerdy and super impressed because not only did she take notice, but she also knew what the name of the plant was.\u201d", "Dr. Santucci later joined the botany club and the two became friends. They began exchanging plants as gifts for birthdays and bonded over plant shows.", "By 2016, Mr. Zhang\u2019s feelings for Dr. Santucci had grown more than platonic. That year, he worked up the courage to ask her what she was doing for Valentine\u2019s Day. \u201cI was actually going to do a movie night with somebody else and I could see he was disappointed so I was like, \u2018Hmm, there\u2019s potential here,\u2019\u201d Dr. Santucci said.", "She agreed to go on a date the next day, however, and Mr. Zhang took Dr. Santucci out for dinner at the Princeton Quadrangle Club. That evening, their friendship officially blossomed into romance when he asked her to be his girlfriend.", "Mr. Zhang, 26, graduated from Princeton in 2016 and is now attending the Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania. Dr. Santucci, 27, graduated from Princeton in 2017 and earned a medical degree at the Perelman School of Medicine in May 2021. She is now completing an intern year in internal medicine at Pennsylvania Hospital in Philadelphia.", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "When they weren\u2019t studying, the couple spent their free time together hiking, gardening, watching movies, traveling and attending flower shows. \u201cHe\u2019s very courageous in trying new things,\u201d Dr. Santucci said. \u201cI am less so, but he encourages me to do that more, which is really healthy for me.\u201d", "In November 2019, they took a trip to the Great Smoky Mountains. While they had talked about marriage, Mr. Zhang wanted to surprise Dr. Santucci with a proposal on the trip.", "But Dr. Santucci had a feeling the question was coming. \u201cThis whole trip was just very nice, very well planned. So I thought it was going to be a special trip, if you know what I mean,\u201d she said.", "Mr. Zhang took care to make the moment distinctive. \u201cI have this side hobby of working with rocks and minerals and things like that, so what I decided to do was make a ring box out of bismuth,\u201d Mr. Zhang said.", "But the box had broken the morning of the proposal and had to be repaired. Two tubes of super glue later, the pair hiked to an overlook at the New River Gorge Bridge where Mr. Zhang got down on one knee.", "The couple were married Oct. 16 at the Princeton Chapel in Princeton, N.J., by the Rev. Dean Alison Boden, a minister at the United Church of Christ. There were 92 guests, most of whom were vaccinated, in attendance and a reception followed at the site of their first date, the Princeton Quadrangle Club.", "Dr. Santucci and Mr. Zhang look forward to finishing their respective studies and continuing to support one another through both good and bad times. \u201cWe always manage to find fun in situations,\u201d Mr. Zhang said. \u201cWe\u2019re very lucky; a lot of times even if something bad happens we still end up having fun.\u201d", "\u201cWe\u2019re super lucky to have the mentors that we\u2019ve had and the people that have guided us along this way to help us be together,\u201d he added."]
